properties.headline: Rip Current Statement issued March 2 at 4:46AM ChST until March 6 at 6:00AM ChST by NWS Tiyan GU
properties.description:
...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NO LONGER IN EFFECT...

.NORTH SWELL HAS DECREASED SUCH THAT SURF HAS FALLEN BELOW HAZARDOUS
LEVELS ALONG NORTH FACING REEFS. HOWEVER...SURF REMAINS LARGE ENOUGH
ALONG EAST FACING REEFS TO MAINTAIN STRONG AND FREQUENT RIP CURRENTS.

THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN TIYAN HAS CANCELLED THE HIGH SURF
ADVISORY.

* ALONG NORTH FACING REEFS...SURF HAS DROPPED BELOW HAZARDOUS LEVELS
OF 9 FEET AND WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY SUBSIDE THE NEXT COUPLE OF
DAYS.

* ALONG EAST FACING REEFS...SURF OF 8 TO 10 FEET WILL MAINTAIN A HIGH
RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. DECREASING SURF LATE
WEEK MAY ALLOW THE RISK OF RIP CURRENTS TO FALL TO MODERATE FRIDAY.
properties.instruction:
STRONG RIP CURRENTS WILL BE LIFE THREATENING ALONG EAST FACING REEFS.
IF YOU BECOME CAUGHT IN A RIP CURRENT...REMAIN CALM. SWIM OUT OF A
RIP CURRENT BY SWIMMING PARALLEL TO SHORE...THEN BACK TOWARD THE
BEACH WHEN POSSIBLE. DO NOT ATTEMPT TO SWIM DIRECTLY AGAINST A RIP
CURRENT AS YOU WILL TIRE QUICKLY.

NWSheadline: HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IS CANCELLED
